body_html: Agreed that in general the names should match the python functions. I haven't delved into the code as much as I should have, but wouldn't it be possible just to keep a list around in python of everything that got "tf.RegisterGradient(...)"-d and check gradient_override_map against it?
body_text: Agreed that in general the names should match the python functions. I haven't delved into the code as much as I should have, but wouldn't it be possible just to keep a list around in python of everything that got "tf.RegisterGradient(...)"-d and check gradient_override_map against it?
body: Agreed that in general the names should match the python functions. I haven't delved into the code as much as I should have, but wouldn't it be possible just to keep a list around in python of everything that got "tf.RegisterGradient(...)"-d and check `gradient_override_map` against it?
